lines.gurmukhi: AwNbn kI sDr kq imtq AwNblI Kwey ipqw ko ipAwr n prosI pih pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Aanban Kee Sadhar Kat Mitat Aanbalee Khaaay , Pitaa Ko Piaar N Parosee Pahi Paaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: How can the desire of eating ripe mango be satiated by eating raw mango? One cannot receive father-like love from one's neighbour.

lines.gurmukhi: swgr kI iniD kq pweIAq poKr sY idnkir sir dIp joiq n pujweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Saagar Kee Nidhi Kat Paaeeat Pokhar Sai , Dinakari Sari Deep Joti N Pujaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: How can one find the wealth of oceans from small ponds? nor can the light of a beacon reach the brightness of the Sun.

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdR brKw smwn pujs n kUp jl cMdn subws n plws mihkweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Indr Barakhaa Samaan Pujas N Koop Jala , Chandan Soubaas N Palaas Mahikaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The water of well cannot reach the water that comes down from the clouds in the form of rain nor can Butea frondosa tree spread fragrance like sandalwood.

lines.gurmukhi: sRI gur dieAwl kI dieAw n Awn dyv mY jau KMf bHmMf audY Asq lau DweIAY ]472]
lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Daiaal Kee Daiaa N Aan Dayv Mai , Jau Khand Brahamand Udai Asat Lau Dhaaeeai ?472?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, no god or goddess can have the amount of kindness that the clement True Guru showers on His Sikhs. One may wander in realms and regions from East to West in search of it.  (472)
